Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Bacteriocin 32 (Bac 32, enterocin IT, entIT; natural AMPs; class 2a bacteriocins; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes)
Sequence Information.Source: Enterococcus faeciumVRE200 (for Bac 32) andEnterococcus faeciumIT62 (for entIT)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: Enterococcus faecium IT62, a strain isolated from ryegrass in Japan, produces three bacteriocins (enterocins L50A, L50B, and IT) encoded in differnt plasmids. Vancomycin-resistant E. faecium (VRE) strain VRE200 harbors the highly efficient conjugative gentamicin resistance plasmid pG200 (70 kb) and bacteriocin plasmid pTI1 (12.5 kb). The bacteriocin encoded on pTI1 (plasmid-encoded) was designated bacteriocin 32 (Bac 32). Bac 32 and entIT are identical (Izquierdo et al., 2009). Found in multiple species.Activity: Bacteriocin 32 was active against E. faecium, E. hirae, and E. durans but showed no activity against L.monocytogenes. Updated 8/2023
Literature Information.Author: Inoue T, Tomita H, Ike Y.2006
Literature Information.Title: Bac 32, a novel bacteriocin widely disseminated among clinical isolates of Enterococcus faecium.
